item.title: 【3 Reasons Why VPs of Engineering Are Choosing Low-Code】工程副总裁选择低代码的 3 个原因
item.description:
【

I often hear the phrases "Low code is not flexible" and "Scaling is the major issue with low code" when talking to developers who have used it to build complex use cases like food ordering apps, e-commerce apps, and tools like that. For any type of application building, it's important to understand who you are developing it for, what is the ROI, and what they are going to achieve. 

Low code is something that can be best used when you want to build apps for internal use, rich data dashboards, CMS apps, or any app for operational needs within your organization. Developers, the primary creators, benefit hugely from pre-built UI components, ready databases, and API integrations. Important stat: 70% of new applications created by enterprises are expected to utilize low-code or no-code technologies, stats Gartner findings. 

】

在与使用它构建复杂用例（例如食品订购应用程序、电子商务应用程序和应用程序）的开发人员交谈时，我经常听到“低代码不灵活”和“扩展是低代码的主要问题”这样的说法。之类的工具。对于任何类型的应用程序构建，重要的是要了解您正在为谁开发它、投资回报率是多少以及他们将实现什么目标。 

低代码是当您想要构建供内部使用的应用程序时最好使用的东西，丰富的数据仪表板、CMS 应用程序或满足组织内运营需求的任何应用程序。开发人员（主要创建者）可以从预构建的 UI 组件、现成的数据库和 API 集成中获益匪浅。重要统计数据：70% 的企业创建的新应用预计将Gartner 调查结果显示，利用低代码或无代码技术。

item.title: 【My Journey to Master SQL Data Analysis】我的 SQL 数据分析之旅
item.description:
【

Dealing with sales data can feel like a task especially when you're trying to extract insights for important business decisions. In this article, we'll delve into the experience of a data analyst tackling these challenges and delve into why mastering SQL is key to achieving success. By the end, you'll grasp the role that data analysts play and how they can transform data into actionable information.

Understanding the Role of a Data Analyst

Data analysts often go unnoticed in organizations. They play a role. Their job involves sorting through volumes of data to identify patterns, trends, and insights that drive decision-making processes. Whether it's analyzing sales figures, customer feedback, or market research findings, data analysts are responsible for making sense of this information. However, this isn't a task. This demands a specific skill set that includes a solid grasp of SQL (Structured Query Language).

】

处理销售数据感觉像是一项任务，尤其是当您尝试提取重要业务决策的见解时。在本文中，我们将深入探讨数据分析师处理问题的经验这些挑战并深入探讨为什么掌握 SQL 是取得成功的关键。最后，您将了解数据分析师所扮演的角色以及他们如何将数据转换为可操作的信息。

了解数据分析师的角色

数据分析师在组织中经常被忽视。他们发挥作用。他们的工作包括对大量数据进行排序，以识别驱动决策过程的模式、趋势和见解。无论是分析销售数据、客户反馈还是市场研究结果，数据分析师都有责任理解这些信息。然而，这不是一个任务。这需要一套特定的技能，其中包括对 SQL（结构化查询语言）的扎实掌握。

item.title: 【Criticality in Data Stream Processing and a Few Effective Approaches】数据流处理的关键性和一些有效的方法
item.description:
【

In the current fast-paced digital age, many data sources generate an unending flow of information: a never-ending torrent of facts and figures that, while perplexing when examined separately, provide profound insights when examined together. Stream processing can be useful in this situation. It fills the void between real-time data collecting and actionable insights. It's a data processing practice that handles continuous data streams from an array of sources. 

About Stream Processing

Opposite to traditional batch data processing techniques, here, processing works on the data as it is produced in real time. In simple words, we can say processing data to get actionable insights when it is in motion before stationary on the repository. Data streaming processing is a continuous method of ingestion, processing, and, eventually, analyzing the data as it is generated from various sources. 

】

在当前快节奏的数字时代，许多数据源都会产生源源不断的信息流：永无休止的事实和数据洪流，虽然单独检查时令人困惑，但放在一起检查时却提供了深刻的见解。流处理在这种情况下很有用。它填补了实时数据收集和可操作的见解之间的空白。这是一种数据处理实践，处理来自一系列源的连续数据流。 

关于流处理

与传统的批量数据处理技术相反，这里的处理是在实时生成的数据上进行的。简而言之，我们可以说，当数据在存储库中静止之前在运动中时，我们可以对数据进行处理以获得可操作的见解。数据流处理是一种持续摄取、处理并最终分析从各种来源生成的数据的方法。
